page.title: 04Village life
page.content: The contrast between village life past and present is striking. The history of the village up to the 185O's is to do with family 'networks', Brownes, Birketts, Longmires, Atkinsons, for example, and to do with farming and slate quarrying. There were wide variations in both wealth and status, but poverty was common. By 185O most of the population were small farmers, some from old families, and a number of small craftsmen and their families. But the coming of the railway to the area in 1847 meant that 'offcomers' or strangers were to become part of the scene. The tendency for relatively wealthy settlers to live in the area but work elsewhere is a pattern established in that period and it continues to the present day. There is little scope for building and most of the old farms are now private homes.
